marklogic.body:
Britton’s rehab impresses Jaguars Jaguars offensive lineman Eben Britton impressed Mularkey with his vigilance in rehabbing from a back surgery and subsequent infection at the site of the surgery last year. Britton played both guard and tackle during the 2011 season, and this year Mularkey hopes to find his home before the season begins. “We’re gonna let him work in different areas [during camp], different Spots,” Mularkey said. “We are going to let him work around because he is that type of guy. He’s going to be a hard guy to keep the field because he has that type of mentality. He’s still coming Off the injury that we’re hoping he’s ready to go when this camp starts up.” Mularkey said right now on the depth chart, Britton is the starting right tackle.
Read more at Jacksonville.com: http://jacksonville.com/sports/football/jaguars/2012-03-28/story/owners-meetings-notebook-jaguars-could-look-defensive-end#ixzz1qY7X2wu2 see how Mularkey said "right now" and see how he said "work in different areas" meaning positions
